title: Public Procurement Procedure Type Vocabulary
description: Controlled vocabulary for high-level types of public procurement procedures and tendering methods.

terms.label: Competitive Dialogue or Competitive Negotiation
terms.definition: A staged procedure where the buyer conducts structured dialogue or negotiations with suppliers before final tenders are submitted.

terms.label: Direct Award
terms.definition: A non-competitive procedure in which the contract is awarded directly to a supplier without an open call for competition.

terms.label: Framework Agreement
terms.definition: A procedure resulting in a framework agreement under which specific contracts may be awarded during a defined period.

terms.label: Negotiated Procedure
terms.definition: A procedure where the buyer negotiates the terms of the contract with one or more suppliers, possibly following a preselection stage.

terms.label: Open Procedure
terms.definition: A procedure in which any qualified supplier may submit a tender in response to a call for competition.

terms.label: Other Procedure Type
terms.definition: A procurement procedure type that does not fit another, more specific category in this vocabulary.

terms.label: Restricted Procedure
terms.definition: A procedure where participation is limited to suppliers invited after a pre-qualification or selection stage.
